blog.name: sodapaladin
blog.title: Paladin of Rubiss
blog.description: Aloha, friends! This is the gaming blog of PawelCyril. Follow me there if you want a smorgasbord of random stuff. Here's where I post video game ramblings and golf video game reviews. I'm an American living in Japan with a love for old JRPGs.

summary: Check out this amazing GameCube wheeled storage box thing I found at a used game store. It’s so ostentatious and cool. It nicely...
body: Check out this amazing GameCube wheeled storage box thing I found at a used game store. It’s so ostentatious and cool. It nicely mounts the GameCube and keeps the cords tidy, as well as storing controllers and the like. I almost want it. Since it has that logo, is it an official GC mop bucket? Wild.

reblog.comment: Check out this amazing GameCube wheeled storage box thing I found at a used game store. It’s so ostentatious and cool. It nicely mounts the GameCube and keeps the cords tidy, as well as storing controllers and the like. I almost want it. Since it has that logo, is it an official GC mop bucket? Wild.

blog.name: thevideogameartarchive
blog.title: The Video Game Art Archive
blog.description:
The Video Game Art Archive is dedicated to scanning and extracting classic video game artwork at the best resolutions possible!

Support us on Patreon!
We update four times a day with new artwork from long forgotten games that have never had their art available. Looking for a specific game? Check out the Archive! You might get lucky!
Also follow our other blog: Want to help us continue our work? Help via PayPAL

summary: It's time for your weekly update! This week I'm once again in the town of LION. Going through Animal Crossing New Leaf towns has...
caption: It’s time for your weekly update! This week I’m once again in the town of LION. Going through Animal Crossing New Leaf towns has been pretty great lately, been finding a lot of fun towns. This week, I’m getting a little sick, but have some fun things going on! I’m finally making progress in beating some games. I also give you a more in depth info on my backlog challenge. blog.name: cellossia
blog.title: cellossia
blog.description: (3)DS games blog + cartoon shit(re)posting because I'm a nostalgic bitch

summary:
Happy Mario Day (｡◕‿◕｡) in celebration, I've decided to rank 7 Mario DS games I own~! 
Let me know if there are any Mario games...
body:
Mario (3)DS games review

Happy Mario Day (｡◕‿◕｡) in celebration, I’ve decided to rank 7 Mario DS games I own~!

Let me know if there are any Mario games I should get in the future

Without further ado…

7. Mario vs. Donkey Kong Mini-Land Mayhem! (2010)

Rating: 1/5 🌟

What I think: dear lord this game is awful. I got it by accident one Christmas, and have tried to like it ever since.

Basically, Donkey Kong kidnaps some lady (I honestly have no clue who she is), but instead of Mario going after her personally, he just sends little toy versions of himself after Donkey Kong?? Okay?? ╮ (. ❛ ᴗ ❛.) ╭

The graphics are terrible and gameplay is usually tedious. It’s mostly a puzzle game, but the puzzles are way too small and unrewarding. There are also no “secrets” which are usually present in Mario games.

The only good thing about the game is that the wind-up Marios you direct are quite cute. That said, they lack the personality of a real Mario, taking away from the game even more.

6. Super Mario Bros. 2 (2012)

Rating: 3/5 🌟 🌟 🌟

What I think: I’m so happy that they brought the Tanuki suit back (it was missing in the first New Super Mario Bros. game), and I also like the new coin block head Mario feature, which I find cute.

So that’s nice, but honestly this game is waaaay too easy. By the time I was in the middle of the second world, I had 126 lives, which imo is unnatural for a Mario game. In Mario you should be suffering + dying lots in order to emerge successfully.

I get the theme of this Mario game is coins and lots of them, but all those easy extra lives make the game less rewarding, and I sped through the levels quite fast.

5. Super Mario 3D Land (2011)

Rating: 3.5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟🌠

What I think: wow 3D Mario!! The 3D function really makes this game better!!! Jk I hate the 3D function. But this game is great without it.

This game is basically Super Mario Bros. 2 without a side-scrolling Mario, but the levels are definitely more challenging. The art + animation is also gorgeous.

I’m sad there’s no multiplayer function for this game, though…and I really don’t like the shiny white Tanuki suit that’s offered if you die too many times. I mean, you really don’t get anything from a game that offers you an easy win! I’m glad you at least have the option to ignore it.

4. Mario Kart 7 (2011)

Rating: 3.5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌠

What I think: who doesn’t love a solid zoom on a Mario mobile? It’s hard to hate a Kart game, but if there’s one thing I can complain about, that’s the lack of Waluigi. If you’re anything like me, you miss that boy quite a bit. Metal Mario and Rosalina do not fill my heart.

If you’ve played Mario Kart before, getting all the trophies isn’t horrible (except Rainbow fucking Road). After you finish the game, there’s not much else to do except race over the Internet. That isn’t the worst, but more tracks and/or characters would be appreciated.

3. New Super Mario Bros. (2006)

Rating: 4/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

What I think: this was the third game I ever got and also my first Mario game, so I obviously have nostalgic + biased feelings about it. I also find the difficulty to be perfect, with extra lives capping at 99.

For flaws, I’d say the graphics aren’t the hottest, and some of the features are a little odd (like, blue koopa Mario is cute af, and rolling around in a shell is great, but what’s the point of it power-up wise??).

That said, this game and its mini game selection are excellent. I also love how unique the levels are and some of the enemies are just so stupid + iconic that it’s hard not to love them (like that one boxer enemy that just punches through bricks… Lol…)

2. Mario Party DS (2007)

Rating: 4.5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌠

What I think: this is definitely one of my favourite games ever. The mini-games are fun, the story is cute, and you can play as Waluigi. Life-changing, I know. (ᴗ ͜ʖ ᴗ)

If you’ve never played a Mario Party game, I’ll fill you in. Bowser (for some unknown reason) has shrunken Mario and friends down to about the size of a mouse. You run around a board (for example, Toadette’s Music Room) as one of the characters, collecting coins and stars, getting smacked by hexes, and sabotaging each other in mini games specific for the shrunken characters.

This game has a lot of replayability, especially when you set characters to “expert”. And it will make you so mad when you land on a two-star hex.

1. Super Mario 64 DS (2004)

Rating: 5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

What I think: well duh this is my number 1. Why, you ask?

-You get to jump through paintings to different worlds.

-It is basically Mario 3D Land, but way more original.

-And you start the game as… Yoshi.

It’s such a unique Mario game concept, and I’ve never gotten sick of it. It’s challenging, but always rewarding as you unlock Mario, Luigi, and Wario (who each have their own special abilities that help complete the game).

I have died on the Red Slide countless times, and I have thrown the baby penguin off the cliff in front of its mother. This game has shaped my being. (✿◠‿◠)

Rating: 4/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

What I think: this was the third game I ever got and also my first Mario game, so I obviously have nostalgic + biased feelings about it. I also find the difficulty to be perfect, with extra lives capping at 99.

For flaws, I’d say the graphics aren’t the hottest, and some of the features are a little odd (like, blue koopa Mario is cute af, and rolling around in a shell is great, but what’s the point of it power-up wise??).

That said, this game and its mini game selection are excellent. I also love how unique the levels are and some of the enemies are just so stupid + iconic that it’s hard not to love them (like that one boxer enemy that just punches through bricks… Lol…)

2. Mario Party DS (2007)

Rating: 4.5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌠

What I think: this is definitely one of my favourite games ever. The mini-games are fun, the story is cute, and you can play as Waluigi. Life-changing, I know. (ᴗ ͜ʖ ᴗ)

If you’ve never played a Mario Party game, I’ll fill you in. Bowser (for some unknown reason) has shrunken Mario and friends down to about the size of a mouse. You run around a board (for example, Toadette’s Music Room) as one of the characters, collecting coins and stars, getting smacked by hexes, and sabotaging each other in mini games specific for the shrunken characters.

This game has a lot of replayability, especially when you set characters to “expert”. And it will make you so mad when you land on a two-star hex.

1. Super Mario 64 DS (2004)

Rating: 5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

What I think: well duh this is my number 1. Why, you ask?

-You get to jump through paintings to different worlds.

-It is basically Mario 3D Land, but way more original.

-And you start the game as… Yoshi.

It’s such a unique Mario game concept, and I’ve never gotten sick of it. It’s challenging, but always rewarding as you unlock Mario, Luigi, and Wario (who each have their own special abilities that help complete the game).

I have died on the Red Slide countless times, and I have thrown the baby penguin off the cliff in front of its mother. This game has shaped my being. (✿◠‿◠)
trail.content:
Mario (3)DS games review

Happy Mario Day (｡◕‿◕｡) in celebration, I’ve decided to rank 7 Mario DS games I own~!

Let me know if there are any Mario games I should get in the future

Without further ado…

7. Mario vs. Donkey Kong Mini-Land Mayhem! (2010)

Rating: 1/5 🌟

What I think: dear lord this game is awful. I got it by accident one Christmas, and have tried to like it ever since.

Basically, Donkey Kong kidnaps some lady (I honestly have no clue who she is), but instead of Mario going after her personally, he just sends little toy versions of himself after Donkey Kong?? Okay?? ╮ (. ❛ ᴗ ❛.) ╭

The graphics are terrible and gameplay is usually tedious. It’s mostly a puzzle game, but the puzzles are way too small and unrewarding. There are also no “secrets” which are usually present in Mario games.

The only good thing about the game is that the wind-up Marios you direct are quite cute. That said, they lack the personality of a real Mario, taking away from the game even more.

6. Super Mario Bros. 2 (2012)

Rating: 3/5 🌟 🌟 🌟

What I think: I’m so happy that they brought the Tanuki suit back (it was missing in the first New Super Mario Bros. game), and I also like the new coin block head Mario feature, which I find cute.

So that’s nice, but honestly this game is waaaay too easy. By the time I was in the middle of the second world, I had 126 lives, which imo is unnatural for a Mario game. In Mario you should be suffering + dying lots in order to emerge successfully.

I get the theme of this Mario game is coins and lots of them, but all those easy extra lives make the game less rewarding, and I sped through the levels quite fast.

5. Super Mario 3D Land (2011)

Rating: 3.5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟🌠

What I think: wow 3D Mario!! The 3D function really makes this game better!!! Jk I hate the 3D function. But this game is great without it.

This game is basically Super Mario Bros. 2 without a side-scrolling Mario, but the levels are definitely more challenging. The art + animation is also gorgeous.

I’m sad there’s no multiplayer function for this game, though…and I really don’t like the shiny white Tanuki suit that’s offered if you die too many times. I mean, you really don’t get anything from a game that offers you an easy win! I’m glad you at least have the option to ignore it.

4. Mario Kart 7 (2011)

Rating: 3.5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌠

What I think: who doesn’t love a solid zoom on a Mario mobile? It’s hard to hate a Kart game, but if there’s one thing I can complain about, that’s the lack of Waluigi. If you’re anything like me, you miss that boy quite a bit. Metal Mario and Rosalina do not fill my heart.

If you’ve played Mario Kart before, getting all the trophies isn’t horrible (except Rainbow fucking Road). After you finish the game, there’s not much else to do except race over the Internet. That isn’t the worst, but more tracks and/or characters would be appreciated.

3. New Super Mario Bros. (2006)

Rating: 4/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

What I think: this was the third game I ever got and also my first Mario game, so I obviously have nostalgic + biased feelings about it. I also find the difficulty to be perfect, with extra lives capping at 99.

For flaws, I’d say the graphics aren’t the hottest, and some of the features are a little odd (like, blue koopa Mario is cute af, and rolling around in a shell is great, but what’s the point of it power-up wise??).

That said, this game and its mini game selection are excellent. I also love how unique the levels are and some of the enemies are just so stupid + iconic that it’s hard not to love them (like that one boxer enemy that just punches through bricks… Lol…)

2. Mario Party DS (2007)

Rating: 4.5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌠

What I think: this is definitely one of my favourite games ever. The mini-games are fun, the story is cute, and you can play as Waluigi. Life-changing, I know. (ᴗ ͜ʖ ᴗ)

If you’ve never played a Mario Party game, I’ll fill you in. Bowser (for some unknown reason) has shrunken Mario and friends down to about the size of a mouse. You run around a board (for example, Toadette’s Music Room) as one of the characters, collecting coins and stars, getting smacked by hexes, and sabotaging each other in mini games specific for the shrunken characters.

This game has a lot of replayability, especially when you set characters to “expert”. And it will make you so mad when you land on a two-star hex.

1. Super Mario 64 DS (2004)

Rating: 5/5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟

What I think: well duh this is my number 1. Why, you ask?

-You get to jump through paintings to different worlds.

-It is basically Mario 3D Land, but way more original.

-And you start the game as… Yoshi.

It’s such a unique Mario game concept, and I’ve never gotten sick of it. It’s challenging, but always rewarding as you unlock Mario, Luigi, and Wario (who each have their own special abilities that help complete the game).

I have died on the Red Slide countless times, and I have thrown the baby penguin off the cliff in front of its mother. This game has shaped my being. (✿◠‿◠)
